project.teaser: The importance of low carbon energy sources in the efforts against rapid climate change makes nuclear energy part of a sustainable energy mix. Although there have been years of experience feedback with water cooled reactors, fundamental improvement, particularly regarding...
project.objective: The importance of low carbon energy sources in the efforts against rapid climate change makes nuclear energy part of a sustainable energy mix. Although there have been years of experience feedback with water cooled reactors, fundamental improvement, particularly regarding intrinsic safety and reduced nuclear waste generation is possible using advanced nuclear designs. Heavy metal cooled systems such as the lead fast reactor (LFR) combine the advantages of a fast reactor system that reduces waste with the intrinsic safety related properties such as the high boiling point, chemical inertia and improved heat transfer. ANSELMUS responds to the Horizon-Euratom -2021-NRT-01-02 call ?Safety of advanced and innovative nuclear designs and fuels. Its objective is to contribute significantly to the safety assessment of heavy-liquid-metal (HLM) systems, in particular ALFRED and MYRRHA as these are included in the roadmap for the development of advanced systems in Europe. It will use the maturity of both designs to create two detailed phenomena identification and ranking tables (PIRT) that identify all verification and validation needs and are used for further safety evaluation. The project will also experimentally validate key safety related sub-systems including the safety rods, failed fuel pin detection and the coolant chemistry control system. We also will improve the validation of numerical models describing the fuel assembly through experiments and simulations and work on reactor safety monitoring and inspection of HLM systems focusing on high temperature vessel inspection. Moreover, ANSELMUS will look into the societal impact of HLM reactors by assessing the integration of LFR in a mixed energy landscape, including economical aspects, and by addressing social and ethical considerations of advanced nuclear technologies. Finally, a dedicated effort will be put into education and dissemination towards all stakeholders including policy makers and the general public.
project.title: Advanced Nuclear Safety Evaluation of Liquid Metal Using Systems
project.keywords: Nuclear Safety, GenIV, Lead, LBE, LFR, ALFRED, MYRRHA

result.description: The deliverable will be the first newsletter of the project after year 2 describing the activities and achievement of the project aimed at a non-specialist public

result.title: ALFRED reference design and initiating events
result.description: This deliverable will describe the reference design of ALFRED and the initiating events in the ALFRED system that will be used for the PIRT analyses.

result.title: MYRRHA reference design and initiating events
result.description: This deliverable will describe the reference design of MYRRHA and the initiating events in the MYRRHA system that will be used for the PIRT analyses.

result.title: HLM course notes
result.description: This deliverable will contain a short report and the lecture notes of the Heavy Liquid Metal course held at SCK CEN

result.description: The deliverable will be the first newsletter of the project after year 1 describing the activities and achievement of the project aimed at a non-specialist public

result.title: Data management FAIR
result.description: This deliverable describes a guide on data management to follow the FAIR principle of the HORIZON EUROPE projects and to ensure the proper management and long-term preservation of the knowledge generated within the project

result.title: Economics and finance of lead fast reactors: A systematic literature review

details.authors: Federico Tassone, Marco Enrico Ricotti, Stefano Lorenzi, Giorgio Locatelli

result.title: Database of available existing wire spaced experiments
result.description: The deliverable will describe the database of available existing wire spaced experiments collected data from open literature, for example experiments performed at KITand TAMUS for H2020 PATRICIA project, data from industrial companies like Terrapower (for as far as they are available). The objective is to generate an extensive database for CFD validation.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ANSELMUS (Advanced Nuclear Safety Evaluation of Liquid Metal Using Systems)
result.teaser: The central objective of the ANSELMUS project is to support the development and deployment of heavy metal cooled advanced nuclear systems in Europe with a focus on MYRRHA and ALFRED. The project is split into five technical work packages, each with their own objectives...

result.title: Design description for the wire-wrapped rod bundle water experiments
result.description: This deliverable provides a description of the experimental set-up and initial test matrix for the wire spaced rod bundle water experiments.

result.title: LFR BOP Main components definition: Definition and sizing of the main components, including sensitivity analysis of both BOP configurations
result.description: The deliverable described the definition and sizing of the main components of the Lead Fast reactor balance of plant.It will also include a sensitivity analysis of both BOP configurations.EAI will evaluate two technologies (i.e. hydrogen production and thermal storage) in the context of the BoP, using simulation models done with the appropriate software (e.g. ECOSIMPRO, Thermoflow). The simulation will be focused in obtaining the most relevant parameters for the project, mainly sizing of components, efficiency, availability of supply and quantity of hydrogen produced / quantity of heat stored.
